core

Class PolygonContenderFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.TilePositionFactory
      • core.PolygonContenderFactory

  • public class PolygonContenderFactory
extends TilePositionFactory
    PolygonContenderFactory.java --- Class for generating Polygons which define a area in which no worker is allowed to construct buildings in.
    Author:
    P H - 10.09.2017

      • generateDefaultContendedPolygons

        public java.util.HashSet<Polygon> generateDefaultContendedPolygons()
        Function for generating the Default contended Polygons that no worker is allowed to build on.
        Returns:
        a HashSet containing all default contended Polygons.

      • contendPolygonInStartingLocation

        private void contendPolygonInStartingLocation(java.util.HashSet<Polygon> designatedHashSet,
                                              java.util.List<bwapi.Unit> startingMinerals,
                                              java.util.List<bwapi.Unit> startingGeysers)
        Function for generating a Polygon located at the Player's starting location that includes the space in between the center and the mineral patch as well as the geyser.
        Parameters:
        designatedHashSet - the HashSet that is going to be filled with all Polygons that are contended from the beginning.
        startingMinerals - the minerals that are located at the starting location of the Player.
        startingGeysers - the geysers that are located at the starting location of the Player.

      • getCenter

        private bwapi.Unit getCenter(java.util.List<bwapi.Unit> units)
        Function for getting a center Unit (CommandCenter, Nexus, ...) from a List of given Units
        Parameters:
        units - the List of Units in which a center Unit is going to be searched for.
        Returns:
        a center Unit if one is found or null.

      • getClosestUnit

        private bwapi.Unit getClosestUnit(java.lang.Iterable<bwapi.Unit> units,
                                  bwapi.Unit targetUnit)
        Function for finding the closest Unit in an iterable collection.
        Parameters:
        units - the collection that is going to be searched.
        targetUnit - the reference Unit to which the closest Unit from the collection is returned later on.
        Returns:
        the closest Unit to the given reference Unit.

      • findUnitsWhichGenerateLargestArea

        private bwapi.Pair<bwapi.Unit,bwapi.Unit> findUnitsWhichGenerateLargestArea(java.util.List<bwapi.Unit> minerals,
                                                                            java.util.List<bwapi.Unit> geysers,
                                                                            Point.Direction mineralsToBase,
                                                                            Point.Direction geysersToBase)
        Function for finding the two Units that together produce the largest area possible. These two Units are chosen from two Lists: the minerals and the geysers. Based on the direction of each one to the center Unit, two are chosen that create a Polygon with the maximum area.
        Parameters:
        minerals - the List of mineral spots from which one Unit is chosen.
        geysers - the List of geysers from which one Unit is chosen.
        mineralsToBase - the direction from the center Unit towards the mineral spots.
        geysersToBase - the direction from the center Unit towards the geysers.
        Returns:
        a Pair of Units that together with the center Unit create a Polygon with the largest possible area.

      • findUnitWithHighestX

        private bwapi.Unit findUnitWithHighestX(java.util.List<bwapi.Unit> units)
        Function for finding the Unit with the highest x coordinate.
        Parameters:
        units - the List of Units that is going to be searched.
        Returns:
        the Unit with the highest x coordinate or null if the List is empty.

      • findUnitWithLowestX

        private bwapi.Unit findUnitWithLowestX(java.util.List<bwapi.Unit> units)
        Function for finding the Unit with the lowest x coordinate.
        Parameters:
        units - the List of Units that is going to be searched.
        Returns:
        the Unit with the lowest x coordinate or null if the List is empty.

      • findUnitWithHighestY

        private bwapi.Unit findUnitWithHighestY(java.util.List<bwapi.Unit> units)
        Function for finding the Unit with the highest y coordinate.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • createStartLocationContendedPolygon

        private Polygon createStartLocationContendedPolygon(bwapi.Unit centerUnit,
                                                    bwapi.Pair<bwapi.Unit,bwapi.Unit> unitsWithGreatestCone,
                                                    Point.Direction mineralsToBase,
                                                    Point.Direction geysersToBase)
        Function for generating a Polygon from the center Unit and two provided Units as well as a fourth one, that is generated individually.
        Parameters:
        centerUnit - the center Unit that the Polygon is starting from.
        unitsWithGreatestCone - the Units whose Positions will function as vertices on the Polygon.
        mineralsToBase - the direction from the center Unit towards the mineral spots.
        geysersToBase - the direction from the center Unit towards the geysers.
        Returns:
        a Polygon covering the largest possible area with the given Units.

      • generateThirdPointForPolygon

        private Point generateThirdPointForPolygon(bwapi.Pair<bwapi.Unit,bwapi.Unit> mineralAndGeyser,
                                           Point.Direction mineralsToBase,
                                           Point.Direction geysersToBase)
        Function for generating another Point for the Polygon, that is inserted at the third position in the List of vertices. This Point marks the Position at which the combined coordinates from the second (geyser or mineral) and the fourth (mineral or geyser) Unit produce the Polygon with the largest possible area.
        Parameters:
        mineralAndGeyser - the Pair of Units that are used to generate the initial Polygon together with the center Unit.
        mineralsToBase - the direction from the center Unit towards the mineral spots.
        geysersToBase - the direction from the center Unit towards the geysers.
        Returns:
        a Point which inserted into the Polygon at the third Position (between the mineral spot and the geyser) produces the largest possible area in a Polygon.

      • contendPolygonsAtChokePoints

        private void contendPolygonsAtChokePoints(java.util.HashSet<Polygon> designatedHashSet)
        Function for generating Polygons around Chokepoints and adding them to a provided HashSet.
        Parameters:
        designatedHashSet - the HashSet that is going to be filled with all Polygons that are contended from the beginning.
